briefdescription.para: constructs the executor with N worker threads

simplesect.para: a std::future to access the execution status of the taskflow

briefdescription.para: runs the taskflow once and invoke a callback upon completion

parameterdescription.para: a callable object to be invoked after this run

simplesect.para: a std::future to access the execution status of the taskflow

briefdescription.para: runs the taskflow for N times

simplesect.para: a std::future to access the execution status of the taskflow

briefdescription.para: runs the taskflow for N times and then invokes a callback

parameterdescription.para: a callable object to be invoked after this run

simplesect.para: a std::future to access the execution status of the taskflow

briefdescription.para: runs the taskflow multiple times until the predicate becomes true and then invokes a callback

parameterdescription.para: a boolean predicate to return true for stop

simplesect.para: a std::future to access the execution status of the taskflow

briefdescription.para: runs the taskflow multiple times until the predicate becomes true and then invokes the callback

parameterdescription.para: a boolean predicate to return true for stop
a callable object to be invoked after this run

simplesect.para: a std::future to access the execution status of the taskflow

briefdescription.para: wait for all pending graphs to complete
queries the number of worker threads (can be zero)
queries the number of running topologies at the time of this call

detaileddescription.para: When a taskflow is submitted to an executor, a topology is created to store runtime metadata of the running taskflow.

briefdescription.para: queries the id of the caller thread in this executor

detaileddescription.para: Each worker has an unique id from 0 to N-1 exclusive to the associated executor. If the caller thread does not belong to the executor, -1 is returned.

F
callable type
ArgsT
parameter types
f
callable object to call
args
parameters to pass to the callable
a std::future that will eventually hold the result of the function call
This method is thread-safe. Multiple threads can launch asynchronous tasks at the same time.

briefdescription.para: similar to tf::Executor::async but does not return a future object
constructs an observer to inspect the activities of worker threads

detaileddescription.para: Each executor manage a list of observers in shared ownership with callers.

parameterdescription.para: arguments to forward to the constructor of the observer

simplesect.para: a shared pointer to the created observer

param.type: std::enable_if_t< std::is_invocable_r_v< void, C, cudaFlow & >, void > *
std::enable_if_t< std::is_invocable_r_v< void, C, cudaFlowCapturer & >, void > *

briefdescription.para: execution interface for running a taskflow graph

detaileddescription.para: An executor object manages a set of worker threads to run taskflow(s) using an efficient work-stealing scheduling algorithm.
